definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
sentences.chinese: 若一国自相分争，那国就站立不住。

sentences.english: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand?
sentences.chinese: 若撒但自相分争，他的国怎能站得住呢。

sentences.english: The church at Corinth was self-destructing because it was filled with division.
sentences.chinese: 哥林多教会因为充满分争而自取灭亡。

sentences.english: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人为这些话，又起了分争。

sentences.english: Thus the people were divided because of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 于是众人因著耶稣起了分争。

sentences.english: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
sentences.chinese: 赶出亵慢人，争端就消除，分争和羞辱，也必止息。

sentences.english: Drive out the mocker, and out goes strife; quarrels and insults are ended.
sentences.chinese: 赶出亵慢人，争端就消除，分争和羞辱，也必止息。

sentences.english: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
sentences.chinese: 若一家自相分争，那家就站立不住。

sentences.english: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
sentences.chinese: 若一国自相分争，那国就站立不住。

definition: to break an agreement/to go back on one's word/to fail to keep one's promise
opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4] (TCM)
to struggle for mastery/to strive for supremacy
